intro: Mesostemma dichotomum, commonly known as the dichotomous mesostem, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its branched stems and small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant has a distinct aromatic scent. Mesostemma dichotomum is often found in meadows and along streambanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
